title: LeBroken needs some counterplay added
body:
Overpowered or not, there is no denying that she is one of most frustrating champions to play against - she needs either her numbers nerfed to the ground (famous Riot modus operandi) or to take some big changes to her kit.

1.) Make her Q a skillshot. Plain and simple. Allows players to dodge the burst.
2.) Make her W have a return delay. Allows a window of opportunity to punish her.
3.) Make her W return immediately disabled by hard CC. Similar to number 2, but with lower window of opportunity and higher payoff if you react accordingly.

Gameplay pattern of dash in/burst with point and click spells and near-instant ground AoE/blink out before anyone can react is far from healthy - champions were given full reworks for much less. Players MUST get an opportunity to either dodge it or be given a sizeable window to fight back. I just want to have some fun in this game, goddammit.

We can ban her in ranked, true, but in half of more of normals there will always be a douchebag wanting to 'have fun' at the expense of fun of other 5 people. Normals, you know. Stuff that most of the people play. Place where people want to have fun and test new stuff.

I normally play either Annie or Zed against her, and they work marvelously against her. 

With {{champion:1}}, survive till 6 by farming with Q. Once you hit six, your full burst does more damage than hers because she probably won't be able to hit an E on you. With {{champion:238}}, you need to survive till you hit lvl 3. Just farm with Q. Activate your E, since she will either take the damage from being right next to you or next to your shadow, then Q to get more damage. If she is low after a trade or two, reactive W to get next to her and auto-attack, procing your passive and probably procing hers. Ignite her and she will be forced to flash or die. If you get behind, just roam to other lanes and splitpush, since you will be able to 1 burst her in due time.

The main issue with this is only one ability (Sans ulted Q) is targeted. QR doesn't do a ton of damage even when fed so she has to hit W or E to kill someone which are skill shots. Not to mention the whole argument about LeBlanc involves her being fed. It's not exactly hard to deal with her or avoid feeding her if you follow these simple tips.

1) Respect the burst - No seriously. Don't be a jerk, don't try to play forward vs her and give her easy damage. 
2) Pick accordingly - If LB is unbanned and you don't play her, especially if you're lower elo, you can expect someone to pick her cause word on the street is she's OP. Cho'gath, Heimer, and pretty much every champ with good wave clear or tankiness very much ruins her day. My go to pick is cho since W completely ruins her day, R gets you tanky as heck, and Q+E help you shove LB to turret which forces her to level W to not miss tons of gold and lowers her overall burst. If you pick before her just play champs that don't suck at pushing or play something with long range. I have had a lot of Lux picks get LB played vs her and I just hang back and play safe and she doesn't get anywhere.
3) Build accordingly - If you're a mage go RoA over tear or chalice, bruisery thing go abyssal, or ad go hexdrinker. It's not hard.
4) Don't be a dick - Kinda like point one but it needs to be reiterated. Don't think you can bully her around, don't play mad aggressive and eat minion damage+q poke, and don't push endlessly and not ward. Ping missings, play safe, and force her to earn her gold the hard way, last hitting. Too many players think to win league games you need to be 15-0 by 10 minutes and play so, so needlessly aggressive that they're extremely punishable and then wonder why they're getting 'camped' or 'how lucky LB is she got away with 10%' or 'lag' or whatever the excuse of the game is.

These aren't going to make you win every game vs LB but you can't win all the time. The removal of her silence made her SOOO much more easy to fight and honestly if you think she's bad now she's not even remotely as oppressive and obnoxious as she once was. At least now you can turn around and try to cc/do your own combo while she does hers, back then you literally had to sit there and wait for LB to let you play before you could even push a button.

Also people can play w/e they want in normals. I play Yorick in normals. I play Panth in normals. Saying someone is a jerk for playing LB in normals is a really loaded statement. Maybe they're learning her for ranked or just like playing her. You don't get to dictate what is fun for other players and even if you don't like it they're entitled to their opinions. League is a game of strategy, even if you don't like playing vs someone you can use the experience to get better as well as try out new ways to deal with LB because normals don't have as much consequence. Every strategy has a counter, develop yours vs LB by playing against her more. 

She's in a fine spot and is a result of a perceived power spike despite her actual power not being as high as everyone says. Lux can 100-0 you from across a lane as well as chunk an entire team in teamfights. Malz can point and click murder someone, Swain is a huge bully and gets really tanky, and Cassi is a turret of absurd dps. Why don't we see these champs more?

Or just play Quinn. Quinn is THE LB hard counter, because she can just E right as LB Ws. Her E will then interrupt LBs W. And since Quinn deals even more damage early than LB, you will just get her to ~30% HP the first time she tries to combo you.

The main problem of Quinn vs LB is that Quinn isn't an amazing pusher and is a squishy carry. It also leaves you with a double adc comp which can be slightly lacking. You may be able to duel LB early as Quinn but Cho not only shuts her down at all stages he also completely ruins her ability to combo your own carries with his long duration silence. Her passive cool down needs to be increased to way more than one minute. Maybe at least 2.

A good place to start would be simply adding a return delay on her distortion. Then seeing how she is from there (In my opinion its bad to nerf so many things at once, otherwise you run the risk of pulling a Riot and overnerfing someone).

It would make it significantly easier to fight her in lane (since the window to trade with her would become much wider).

While we're at it fix the hitbox on her E, sometimes it connects when it should miss, and then others it misses when it should connect.

**TL;DR:**
my ultimate point here: LeBlanc is powerful, difficult to react to and has a heavily skewed risk to rewards proportion. What makes this infuriating is that her counterplay just isn't rewarding. If you react properly, she still isn't heavily punished as frequently as she should be.
-----
**Long Version**

I'd vote for number three. yeah LB has counterplay but it's horribly unrewarding and is way harder to perform than it is for LB to do her combo. This results in two things: Unequal effort and unequal reward.
-----
Unequal effort is frustrating because LeBlanc puts in little effort to take nearly have of your health bar in one .6 sec combo, but you have to have extremely good reflexes to react. To be specific, the average human requires .2 sec to recognize a threat, let alone react. Is it possible? Absolutely. Is it harder than what LB has to do? Without question.
-----
Unequal reward is what makes this a problem. Can unequal effort be okay? Yes, it actually can, depending on the rewards. We saw the low risk and high reward proportions for LeBlanc's combo, but how about her counterplay? It essentially amounts to "Okay, you're not deleted instantly, but you're low on health. Now you get to back before my low CDs are up again to finish you off."
-----
Solution number 3 is good, because it reminds me of a certain other AP mid assassin that rustles jimmies and snowballs like mad. Katarina. Annoying? Yeah. Hard to use? Nope, just hard to master. Easy to react to? Mehhh, depends on how the Kat player plays. However, one thing is certain. If you react to Katarina properly, **SHE BECOMES VERY VULNERABLE**. She probably used Shunpo to go in, and with no reset, that leaves her with very little options to escape with and you just stopped her primary source of damage. If she doesn't die, she sure as Hell isn't going to win the engagement. With LeBlanc, she'll just immediately teleport back out.
-----

Out of the group, I'd say #3 is the best solution. It'll give the player a "GOTCHA BITCH" feeling, while also making LeBlanc a better choice for CC-less  champions. In other words, people will be less inclined to pick her into Xerath/Viktor/etc.

Yesterday, I saw a post where someone said that the reason Leblanc and Zed are broken is their ability to teleport back to safety effortlessly after blowing their full damage combo on someone. I'm inclined to agree.

He teleports to his shadow and gets away. Stay at his shadow? You just let him walk away. There's two of you so you can cover both? Odds are once you're separated he can kill one of you and walk away. Three? Same, he'll just go for the loner. 

You need at least four people to stop a running Zed, and that's on top of his absurd burst. Leblanc has similar issues with her clone added on top tp confuse you.
